Universe¶

class Universe

A universe represents an unbounded space in the 2D xy-plane.

A universe contains cell which are bounded subspaces in the 2D xy-plane and which together form the universe. Universes allow for complex, repeating (ie lattices) geometries to be simply represented with as few data structures as possible.

Public Functions

Universe(const short int id)

Constructor assigns a unique and user-specified ID for the universe.

Parameters
  • id -

    the user-specified universe id

~Universe()

Destructor clears the cell pointers container.

void addCell(Cell * cell)

Adds a cell to this universe.

Stores the user-specified cell ID and cell pointer in a hash table along with all of other cells added to this universe.

Parameters
  • cell -

    the cell id

std::map< short int, Cell * > getCells()

Return the vector of cell pointers in this universe.

Return
vector of cell ids

short int getUid()

Returns the universe’s unique ID.

Return
the universe’s unique ID.

short int getId()

Return the user-specified ID for this universe.

Return
the user-specified universe ID

universeType getType()

Return the universe type (SIMPLE or LATTICE).

Return
the universe type

short int getNumCells()

Return the number of cells in this universe.

Return
the number of cells

int getFSR(short int cell_id)

Returns the local ID for the FSR representing a cell in this universe.

This method is used when constructing an ID for a FSR.

Parameters
  • cell_id -

    the ID of the cell of interest

Point * getOrigin()

Return a pointer to the origin for this cell (in global coordinates).

Return
the origin of the cell

void setType(universeType type)

Sets the universe type to SIMPLE or LATTICE.

Parameters
  • type -

    the universe type

void setOrigin(Point * origin)

Set the origin in global coordinates for this universe.

Parameters
  • origin -

    a pointer to the origin

Cell * findCell(LocalCoords * coords, std::map< short int, Universe * > universes)

Finds the cell for which a localcoords object resides.

Finds the cell that a localcoords object is located inside by checking each of this universe’s cells. Returns NULL if the localcoords is not in any of the cells.

Return
a pointer the cell where the localcoords is located
Parameters
  • coords -

    a pointer to the localcoords of interest

  • universes -

    a container of all of the universes passed in by geometry

int computeFSRMaps()

Compute the FSR maps for this universe and return the number of FSRs inside the universe.

The FSR map is simply a hash table of the local FSR IDs for each of the cells making up this universe. This is used when constructing a global FSR ID for a lattice which may contain several repeating versions of this universe.

Return
the number of FSRs in the universe

void subdivideCells()

Subdivides all of the cells within this universe into rings and angular sectors.

std::string toString()

Convert the member attributes of this universe to a character array.

Return
a character array reprsenting the universe

void printString()

Prints a string representation of all of the universe’s objects to the console.
